---
title: Osteopathic Manipulation
---

2 categories:  direct and indirect @tuckeyFascialCounterstrainMethodological2025

- *Direct techniques*: attempt to resolve somatic dysfunction through forces applied directly against identified restrictive barriers [2].
- **Indirect techniques**:  Indirectly resolves somatic dysfunction, by performing tissue slackening or decompression which improves circulation and/or reduces interstitial inflammation which interrupts the pathophysiological continuous state of chemical excitation of peripheral nociceptors resulting in chronic pain
